newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money market rates dive on excess funds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money market rates dive on excess funds.

text.p: Pakistan overnight money market rates closed at 3.00 percent on Saturday, compared to 17 percent on Friday, owing to excess liquidity in the banking system, dealers said.
Initial deals were struck at 10 percent but the rates fell later to 4.00 percent owing to a lack of borrowing interest, a dealer at a foreign bank said.
The overnight market was seen quiet in the last hour of trading with a few deals done at 3.00 percent, the dealer said.
